bibl.title: Letter from [Morris Sheppard] to Patrick J. Hurley, January 31, 1930

div1.p: [Sheppard] clarifies his statements regarding Ames' service with the Yellow Fever Board, in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from [Morris Sheppard] to Patrick J. Hurley, January 31, 1930
div1.opener:
COPY
From Mrs Ames
UNITED STATES SENATE
Committee on
Irrigation and Reclamation
January 31, 1930
My dear Mr. Secretary:
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of January 29 in
reference to the record of the service of Dr. Roger
P. Ames, Assistant Surgeon, United States Army.
Evidently I did not make myself entirely clear in my
letter to you of December 31. What I wish to ask is
that it be noted on his record that he was stricken with
yellow fever immediately or soon after performing the
work assigned him in connection with the yellow fever
experiments under Major Walter Reed. Kindly let me
know if the records do not justify this notation on his
official record. I have the documents showing that he
was stricken with this disease immediately or soon after
the work above mentioned.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Hon. Patrick J. Hurley
Secretary of War
Washington, D. C.
